required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-Label Study of Duloxetine in the Treatment of Children and Adolescents With Major Depressive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: F1J-MC-HMFN (a) An Open-Label Study of Tolerability, Safety, and Pharmacokinetics of Duloxetine in the Treatment of Children and Adolescents With Major Depressive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of your participation in this study is to help answer the following research question, and not to provide you treatment for your condition. Whether duloxetine once daily orally is tolerated and safe, in children (aged 7 through 11 years) and adolescents (aged 12 through 17 years) with Major Depressive Disorder.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Emergence of Suicidal Ideation During Period II/III
primary_outcome.description: Emergence of Any Suicidal Ideation: Item 13 of Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised (CDRS-R) has possible scores of 1 (no thoughts of suicide) to 7 (contemplation of suicide). Emergence of suicidal ideation was defined as an increase in severity of suicidal ideation for those patients who did not have suicidal ideation at baseline (Week 0).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Emergence of Suicidal Ideation During Period IV
primary_outcome.description: Emergence of Any Suicidal Ideation: Item 13 of Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised (CDRS-R) has possible scores of 1 (no thoughts of suicide) to 7 (contemplation of suicide). Emergence of suicidal ideation was defined as an increase in severity of suicidal ideation for those patients who did not have suicidal ideation at baseline (Week 0).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Suicidal Ideation or Suicidal Behavior Based on Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) During Period II/III
primary_outcome.description: The C-SSRS captures the occurrence, severity, and frequency of suicide-related thoughts and behaviors during the assessment period. Some questions are yes/no and some are on a scale of 1 (low severity) to 5 (high severity). Completed suicide and non-fatal suicide events are yes/no questions and results presented are the number of participants with these events. Worsening of suicidal ideation was an increase in severity of suicidal ideation from baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Suicidal Ideation or Suicidal Behavior Based on Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) During Period IV
primary_outcome.description: The C-SSRS captures the occurrence, severity, and frequency of suicide-related thoughts and behaviors during the assessment period. Some questions are yes/no and some are on a scale of 1 (low severity) to 5 (high severity). Completed suicide and non-fatal suicide events are yes/no questions and results presented are the number of participants with these events. Worsening of suicidal ideation was an increase in severity of suicidal ideation from baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant Vital Sign Values at Any Time During Period II/III
primary_outcome.description: Total number of patients with any abnormal post-baseline value, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits. Criteria: High Diastolic Blood Pressure = increase of at least 5 mmHg to a value above the 95th percentile; High Systolic Blood Pressure = increase of at least 5 mmHg to a value above the 95th percentile; High Pulse = increase of at least 25 to a value of at least 110.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant Vital Sign Values at Any Time During Period IV
primary_outcome.description: Total number of patients with any abnormal post-baseline value, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits. Criteria: High Diastolic Blood Pressure = increase of at least 5 mmHg to a value above the 95th percentile; High Systolic Blood Pressure = increase of at least 5 mmHg to a value above the 95th percentile; High Pulse = increase of at least 25 to a value of at least 110.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant (PCS) Laboratory Analyte Values at Any Time During Period II/III
primary_outcome.description: The results shown are for all laboratory analytes where PCS criteria were met, based on criteria used for adult studies. Criteria: High Alanine transaminase (>165 Units/Liter [U/L]); High Creatine Phosphokinase (females: >507 U/L; males:>594 U/L); Low Glucose (<2.498 millimoles/L); Low Hematocrit (females: <0.32; males <0.37); Low Hemoglobin (females <5.896 millimoles/L [mmol/L] iron; males <7.137 mmol/L iron); High Inorganic Phosphorus (>1.776 millimoles/L); Low Leukocyte Count (<2.8 X10^9/L).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant (PCS) Laboratory Analyte Values at Any Time During Period IV
primary_outcome.description: The results shown are for all laboratory analytes where PCS criteria were met, based on criteria used for adult studies. Criteria: High Alkaline Phosphatase (>420 Units/Liter [U/L]); Low Hematocrit (females <0.32; males <0.37); High Inorganic Phosphorus (>1.776 millimoles/L).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant Electrocardiograms at Any Time in Period II/III
primary_outcome.description: Total number of patients with any abnormal post-baseline values, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits. Criteria: High QRS Interval = ≥100 milliseconds (msec); High QTc Bazette's or Fredericia's correction - Female = ≥470 msec; High QTc Bazette's or Fredericia's correction - Male = ≥450 msec.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Electrocardiograms at Any Time in Period IV
primary_outcome.description: Total number of patients with any abnormal post-baseline values, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits. Criteria: High QRS Interval = ≥100 milliseconds (msec); High QTc Bazette's or Fredericia's correction - Female = ≥470 msec; High QTc Bazette's or Fredericia's correction - Male = ≥450 msec.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Summary of Observed Duloxetine Plasma Concentrations Stratified by Duloxetine Dose
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained at steady state, and approximately 95% of duloxetine concentrations were within the 24 hour dosing interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 18 Weeks and 30 Weeks in Clinical Global Impressions of Severity Scale (CGI-S)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures severity of illness at the time of assessment compared with start of treatment. Scores range from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients). Baseline is the same timepoint (Week 0) for both comparisons, but due to differences in number of patients in both periods (II/III vs IV), the baseline values may be slightly different.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 18 Weeks and 30 Weeks in Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised (CDRS-R) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Measures presence and severity of depression. Consists of 17 items scored on a 1-5 or 1-7 scale. A rating of 1 indicates normal, thus the minimum score is 17. The maximum score is 113. In general, scores below 20 indicate an absence of depression; scores of 20 or 30 indicate borderline depression; scores of 40 to 60 indicate moderate depression. Baseline is the same timepoint (Week 0) for both comparisons, but due to differences in number of patients in both periods (II/III vs IV), the baseline values may be slightly different.

intervention.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) for 30 weeks; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male / Female outpatients 7 to 17 years of age diagnosed with Major Depressive Disorder (MDD). (Must have a Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised [CDRS-R] with a total score greater than or equal to 40 at Visit 1, Visit 2, and Visit 3 and a Clinical Global Impressions of Severity [CGI-Severity] rating of greater than or equal to 4 at Visit 1, Visit 2, and Visit 3.)
- Female patients must test negative on a pregnancy at visit 1.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a serious or unstable medical illness, psychological condition, clinically significant laboratory or electrocardiogram (ECG) result, hypersensitivity to duloxetine, or to its inactive ingredients, frequent or severe allergic reactions to multiple medications, uncontrolled narrow-angle glaucoma, acute liver injury (for example, hepatitis) or severe cirrhosis (Child-Pugh Class C) that in the opinion of the investigator would compromise participation in the study or be likely to lead to hospitalization during the course of the study.
- Have a current or previous diagnosis of bipolar disorder, psychotic depression, schizophrenia or other psychotic disorder, anorexia, bulimia, obsessive compulsive disorder, pervasive development disorder or borderline personality disorder, as determined by the investigator.
- Have a significant suicide attempt within 1 year of Visit 1 or have a score of 5 or greater on Item 13 (Suicidal Ideation) on the CDRS-R at Visit 1, Visit 2, or Visit 3, or are currently at risk of suicide in the opinion of the investigator.
- Have a weight less than 20 kg at any Screening Phase visit.
- Have previous exposure to duloxetine
- Female patients who are either pregnant, nursing or have recently given birth.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Period I was a 2-week Screening/Washout Phase. Period II was a 10-week Dose-Titrating with Pharmacokinetic Sampling Phase. Period III was an 8-week Safety and Tolerability Phase. Period IV was a 3-month Extended Safety and Tolerability Phase. Period V was a 2-week Taper Phase. Results presented are for combined Periods II/III and Period IV.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) for 30 weeks; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

participants_list.participants: Includes 1 patient who withdrew at last visit; didn't enter Taper; however received 30 weeks of drug

measure.description: Tobacco use was based on cotinine level.

measure.description: Body mass index is an estimate of body fat based on body weight divided by height squared.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant Vital Sign Values at Any Time During Period II/III
outcome.description: Total number of patients with any abnormal post-baseline value, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits. Criteria: High Diastolic Blood Pressure = increase of at least 5 mmHg to a value above the 95th percentile; High Systolic Blood Pressure = increase of at least 5 mmHg to a value above the 95th percentile; High Pulse = increase of at least 25 to a value of at least 110.
outcome.population: Number of patients with baseline (and none abnormal) and post-baseline values, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) for 30 weeks; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics: Summary of Observed Duloxetine Plasma Concentrations Stratified by Duloxetine Dose
outcome.description: Plasma samples were obtained at steady state, and approximately 95% of duloxetine concentrations were within the 24 hour dosing interval.
outcome.population: Number of patients in each duloxetine dose.

group.title: Duloxetine Dose - 20 mg
group.description: 20 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO); If patient is ≤40kg, initial dose is 20mg, then titrated up.

group.title: Duloxetine Dose - 30 mg
group.description: 30 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO); If patient is ≤40kg, initial dose is 20mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40kg, initial dose is 30mg, then titrated up.

group.title: Duloxetine - 60 mg
group.description: 60 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO); If patient is ≤40kg, initial dose is 20mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40kg, initial dose is 30mg, then titrated up.

group.title: Duloxetine Dose - 90 mg
group.description: 90 milligrams (mg) every day (QD), by mouth (PO); If patient is ≤40kg, initial dose is 20mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40kg, initial dose is 30mg, then titrated up.

group.title: Duloxetine - 120 mg
group.description: 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO); If patient is ≤40kg, initial dose is 20mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40kg, initial dose is 30mg, then titrated up.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics: Summary of Observed Duloxetine Plasma Concentrations Stratified by Duloxetine Dose
measure.description: Plasma samples were obtained at steady state, and approximately 95% of duloxetine concentrations were within the 24 hour dosing interval.
measure.population: Number of patients in each duloxetine dose.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 18 Weeks and 30 Weeks in Clinical Global Impressions of Severity Scale (CGI-S)
outcome.description: Measures severity of illness at the time of assessment compared with start of treatment. Scores range from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients). Baseline is the same timepoint (Week 0) for both comparisons, but due to differences in number of patients in both periods (II/III vs IV), the baseline values may be slightly different.
outcome.population: 18 Week results are for all enrolled patients with a baseline and at least one non-missing post-baseline value; 30 Week results are for the enrolled patients with a baseline and at least one non-missing post-baseline value in Period IV. Last observation carried forward.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) for 30 weeks; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

outcome.description: Measures presence and severity of depression. Consists of 17 items scored on a 1-5 or 1-7 scale. A rating of 1 indicates normal, thus the minimum score is 17. The maximum score is 113. In general, scores below 20 indicate an absence of depression; scores of 20 or 30 indicate borderline depression; scores of 40 to 60 indicate moderate depression. Baseline is the same timepoint (Week 0) for both comparisons, but due to differences in number of patients in both periods (II/III vs IV), the baseline values may be slightly different.
outcome.population: 18 Week results are for all enrolled patients with a baseline and at least one non-missing post-baseline value; 30 Week results are for the enrolled patients with a baseline and at least one non-missing post-baseline value in Period IV. Last observation carried forward.

The maximum score is 113. In general, scores below 20 indicate an absence of depression; scores of 20 or 30 indicate borderline depression; scores of 40 to 60 indicate moderate depression. outcome.title: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant (PCS) Laboratory Analyte Values at Any Time During Period II/III
outcome.description: The results shown are for all laboratory analytes where PCS criteria were met, based on criteria used for adult studies. Criteria: High Alanine transaminase (>165 Units/Liter [U/L]); High Creatine Phosphokinase (females: >507 U/L; males:>594 U/L); Low Glucose (<2.498 millimoles/L); Low Hematocrit (females: <0.32; males <0.37); Low Hemoglobin (females <5.896 millimoles/L [mmol/L] iron; males <7.137 mmol/L iron); High Inorganic Phosphorus (>1.776 millimoles/L); Low Leukocyte Count (<2.8 X10^9/L).
outcome.population: Total number of patients with baseline (and none abnormal) and post-baseline values, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) for 30 weeks; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

measure.title: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant (PCS) Laboratory Analyte Values at Any Time During Period II/III
measure.description: The results shown are for all laboratory analytes where PCS criteria were met, based on criteria used for adult studies. Criteria: High Alanine transaminase (>165 Units/Liter [U/L]); High Creatine Phosphokinase (females: >507 U/L; males:>594 U/L); Low Glucose (<2.498 millimoles/L); Low Hematocrit (females: <0.32; males <0.37); Low Hemoglobin (females <5.896 millimoles/L [mmol/L] iron; males <7.137 mmol/L iron); High Inorganic Phosphorus (>1.776 millimoles/L); Low Leukocyte Count (<2.8 X10^9/L).
measure.population: Total number of patients with baseline (and none abnormal) and post-baseline values, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant (PCS) Laboratory Analyte Values at Any Time During Period IV
outcome.description: The results shown are for all laboratory analytes where PCS criteria were met, based on criteria used for adult studies. Criteria: High Alkaline Phosphatase (>420 Units/Liter [U/L]); Low Hematocrit (females <0.32; males <0.37); High Inorganic Phosphorus (>1.776 millimoles/L).
outcome.population: Total number of patients with baseline (and none abnormal) and post-baseline values in Period IV, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) for 30 weeks; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

measure.title: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant (PCS) Laboratory Analyte Values at Any Time During Period IV
measure.description: The results shown are for all laboratory analytes where PCS criteria were met, based on criteria used for adult studies. Criteria: High Alkaline Phosphatase (>420 Units/Liter [U/L]); Low Hematocrit (females <0.32; males <0.37); High Inorganic Phosphorus (>1.776 millimoles/L).
measure.population: Total number of patients with baseline (and none abnormal) and post-baseline values in Period IV, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Meeting Criteria for Potentially Clinically Significant Electrocardiograms at Any Time in Period II/III
outcome.description: Total number of patients with any abnormal post-baseline values, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits. Criteria: High QRS Interval = ≥100 milliseconds (msec); High QTc Bazette's or Fredericia's correction - Female = ≥470 msec; High QTc Bazette's or Fredericia's correction - Male = ≥450 msec.
outcome.population: Number of patients with baseline (and none abnormal) and post-baseline values, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) for 30 weeks; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

measure.description: Total number of patients with any abnormal post-baseline values, based on all values at scheduled and unscheduled visits. Criteria: High QRS Interval = ≥100 milliseconds (msec); High QTc Bazette's or Fredericia's correction - Female = ≥470 msec; High QTc Bazette's or Fredericia's correction - Male = ≥450 msec.

outcome.title: Adverse Events Leading to Discontinuation
outcome.description: A listing of adverse events leading to discontinuation from the study. Abbreviation in data table: ADHD = Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) for 30 weeks; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

measure.title: Adverse Events Leading to Discontinuation
measure.description: A listing of adverse events leading to discontinuation from the study. Abbreviation in data table: ADHD = Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder.

reported_events.time_frame: Duloxetine - Period II/III: Week 0 (Baseline) to Week 18; Duloxetine - Period IV: Week 18 to Week 30
reported_events.desc: In the opinion of the investigator, none of the Serious Adverse Events were considered related to the study drug.

group.title: Duloxetine - Period II/III
group.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) for 18 weeks; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

group.title: Duloxetine - Period IV
group.description: 20 - 120 milligrams (mg) every day, once-daily (QD), by mouth (PO) between Weeks 18 - 30; If patient is ≤40 kilograms (kg), initial dose is 20 mg, then titrated up. If patient is >40 kg, initial dose is 30 mg, then titrated up.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The Results Record was revised as a result of correcting identified errors in the number of participants with potentially significant changes in blood pressure.
